uber_roles.title: Software Engineer Intern - University Ops
must_have: Proficiency in one: Python, Java, or Go
uber_roles.description: Jumpstart your career with Uber. Work on production code that impacts millions of riders while being mentored by world-class engineers.

uber_roles.title: Backend Engineer - Fulfillment Core
uber_roles.description: Responsible for the reliability of the 'Request a Ride' API. You will focus on writing clean, bug-free code for the matching engine.

uber_roles.title: Software Engineer II - Payments Ledger
uber_roles.description: Scaling the payment gateway to handle 1M+ transactions per second. Ensuring data consistency across distributed ledgers is paramount.

uber_roles.title: Senior Engineer - Marketplace Dynamics
uber_roles.description: Owning the surge pricing and driver supply-demand algorithms. You must optimize for p99 latency under extreme load.

uber_roles.title: Tech Lead - Rider Experience
uber_roles.description: Driving the roadmap for the Uber Rider app's global features. You bridge the gap between Product Managers and Engineering execution.

uber_roles.title: Staff Engineer - Infrastructure & Storage
uber_roles.description: Architecting the global backbone of Uber's infrastructure. Impacting cross-org initiatives.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Spring Boot Actuator? How do you use its endpoints to monitor application health at Uber?
Explain Authentication vs Authorization in Spring Security. How would you implement OAuth2 for a secure payment microservice?
What are the common HTTP status codes for partial success or duplicate requests? How do you handle idempotency in REST?
What all details will you keep in mind while migrating from a monolithic architecture to microservices for a high-traffic app like Uber?
How will you design microservices and establish proper communication among them? Explain with design patterns like API Gateway or Broker-based messaging.
Define the Saga Design Pattern. How does it ensure data consistency across multiple independent services during a distributed transaction?
How will you design a car rental app like 'Zoom Car'? Focus on vehicle availability tracking and real-time booking.
For a read-heavy system (e.g., viewing driver reviews), what architectural choices would you make to ensure low latency?
For a critical payment service, what mechanisms should you implement for fault tolerance (e.g., Circuit Breaker, Retries, Dead Letter Queues)?
